biography: Pete Wiggs (born15 May 1966, Reigate, England) is an English musician, producer, songwriter and DJ, best known for being one third of Saint Etienne. Since the mid-2000's, he has completed a sizeable amount of remixes for other artists, mostly using Saint Etienne as an alias but also under his own name. In December 2014, his first official solo recording effort was released - Saint Etienne Presents How We Used to Live, a soundtrack for the documentary film of the same name. His second solo release was in April 2018 and was the soundtrack to the short film Abstractions of Holderness, made by Saint Etienne bandmate, Bob Stanley. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
name: Pete Wiggs

lastfm.bio_content: Pete Wiggs (born15 May 1966, Reigate, England) is an English musician, producer, songwriter and DJ, best known for being one third of Saint Etienne. Since the mid-2000's, he has completed a sizeable amount of remixes for other artists, mostly using Saint Etienne as an alias but also under his own name. In December 2014, his first official solo recording effort was released - Saint Etienne Presents How We Used to Live, a soundtrack for the documentary film of the same name. His second solo release was in April 2018 and was the soundtrack to the short film Abstractions of Holderness, made by Saint Etienne bandmate, Bob Stanley. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
